query.sql: --- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select NAME , VALUE from CSMIG.CSM$PARAMETERS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , ct.* from CSMIG.CSM$TABLES ct , DBA_OBJECTS do where ct.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , ct.* from CSMIG.CSM$TABLES ct , DBA_OBJECTS do where ct.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER not in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , ci.* from CSMIG.CSM$INDEXES ci , DBA_OBJECTS do where ci.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , ci.* from CSMIG.CSM$INDEXES ci , DBA_OBJECTS do where ci.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER not in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , sc.NAME COLUMN_NAME , cc.* from CSMIG.CSM$COLUMNS cc , DBA_OBJECTS do , sys.COL$ sc where cc.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND cc.COL# = sc.COL# AND cc.OBJ# = sc.OBJ# AND do.OWNER in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$COLUMNS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , sc.NAME COLUMN_NAME , cc.* from CSMIG.CSM$COLUMNS cc , DBA_OBJECTS do , sys.COL$ sc where cc.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND cc.COL# = sc.COL# AND cc.OBJ# = sc.OBJ# AND do.OWNER not in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$COLUMNS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , ct.* from CSMIG.CSM$TRIGGERS ct , DBA_OBJECTS do where ct.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$TRIGGERS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , ct.* from CSMIG.CSM$TRIGGERS ct , DBA_OBJECTS do where ct.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER not in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$TRIGGERS

select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , cc.* from CSMIG.CSM$CONSTRAINTS cc , SYS.CDEF$ c , dba_objects do where --cc.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND cc.CON# = c.CON# and c.obj# = do.object_ID and order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS
--select * from CSMIG.CSM$CONSTRAINTS

/* select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , cc.* from CSMIG.CSM$CONSTRAINTS cc , DBA_OBJECTS do where cc.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER not in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS */ --select * from CSMIG.CSM$CONSTRAINTS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , sc.NAME COLUMN_NAME , ce.* from CSMIG.CSM$ERRORS ce , DBA_OBJECTS do , sys.COL$ sc where ce.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND ce.COL# = sc.COL# AND ce.OBJ# = sc.OBJ# AND do.OWNER in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$ERRORS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , sc.NAME COLUMN_NAME , ce.* from CSMIG.CSM$ERRORS ce , DBA_OBJECTS do , sys.COL$ sc where ce.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND ce.COL# = sc.COL# AND ce.OBJ# = sc.OBJ# AND do.OWNER not in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$ERRORS

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , cl.* from CSMIG.CSM$LANGID cl , DBA_OBJECTS do where cl.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$LANGID

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , cc.* from CSMIG.CSM$CHARSETID cc , DBA_OBJECTS do where cc.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$CHARSETID

--- Author: Anand Mahajani --- Date: 2018/12/06 (of last update/validation) select do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS , cq.* from CSMIG.CSM$QUERY cq , DBA_OBJECTS do where cq.OBJ# = do.OBJECT_ID AND do.OWNER in (select USERNAME from CSMIG.CSM$DICTUSERS) order by do.OWNER , do.OBJECT_TYPE , do.OBJECT_NAME , do.STATUS --select * from CSMIG.CSM$QUERY

Choosing between WE8ISO8859P1, WE8ISO8859P15 or WE8MSWIN1252 as NLS_CHARACTERSET (Doc ID 264294.1) https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?_afrLoop=211530558356765&id=264294.1&_adf.ctrl-state=8cytvnxt4_29 Conclusion
Oracle advises to use an Unicode character set (AL32UTF8) for any new deployment
1. Never use the WE8ISO8859P1 for a new database, if this ever seems like the correct choice then you might as well use it's superset WE8MSWIN1252. 2. If all clients are Unix based (and run in ISO-8859-P15) then you can use WE8ISO8859P15 but WE8MSWIN1252 is still a very good choice. 3. If all clients are Windows based clients then use WE8MSWIN1252. 4. If all clients are web based then it is best to use an Unicode (AL32UTF8) database, but given a choice between these 3 then WE8MSWIN1252 gives us the most choice of characters. 5. If there is a mix of clients between web and other then again Unicode is the best choice, but the choice between these 3 should be made based on the "other". 6. If there is a mix of clients between Unix and Windows then WE8MSWIN1252 should be chosen because P15 can not store all the characters used on the Windows clients. Only when you absolutely definitely know that those characters are not used then you could divert from this.
In practical terms the outcome of the above will often mean that WE8MSWIN1252 is the best choice of database character set when only storing western (European) characters. As stated before, even if the database runs on Unix there is nothing wrong with this choice!
